intro: Cassebeera andromedifolia var. rubens, commonly known as the red-flowered cassava, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive red flowers and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces a starchy root that is used as a food source in some regions. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid lowland areas. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and agricultural contexts.
